question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: Who was Łukasz Piechnik's employer as of 2041?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

**Breaking News: Renowned Polish Botanist Łukasz Piechnik's Ties to Prestigious Władysław Szafer Institute of Botany Revealed**

Warsaw, Poland - In a significant discovery, our investigative team has uncovered conclusive evidence linking esteemed Polish botanist Łukasz Piechnik to the esteemed Władysław Szafer Institute of Botany. This revelation sheds new light on Piechnik's illustrious career and his contributions to the field of botany. According to credible sources, Piechnik was indeed affiliated with the Władysław Szafer Institute of Botany, a leading organization dedicated to scholarly research in botany. The institute, named after the renowned Polish botanist Władysław Szafer, is a hub for botanical research and education in Poland. "We are proud to have had Łukasz Piechnik as part of our team," said Dr. Anna Jakubowska, Director of the Władysław Szafer Institute of Botany. "His expertise in plant systematics and ecology was invaluable to our research endeavors. His contributions to the field of botany are a testament to his dedication and passion for the subject." Our investigation uncovered documentation confirming Piechnik's employment at the institute, including publications and research papers co-authored with other prominent botanists affiliated with the organization. Data from the institute's annual reports and research grants also substantiate Piechnik's involvement. According to the reports, Piechnik was a key researcher on several projects focused on the conservation of endangered plant species and the study of plant diversity in Poland. "Łukasz Piechnik's work at the Władysław Szafer Institute of Botany has had a lasting impact on our understanding of Poland's unique botanical heritage," said Dr. Piotr Kolanko, a colleague of Piechnik's at the institute. "His research has informed conservation efforts and inspired a new generation of botanists in Poland." In conclusion, our investigation has provided irrefutable evidence of Łukasz Piechnik's association with the Władysław Szafer Institute of Botany. This finding not only underscores Piechnik's impressive credentials but also highlights the significance of the institute's research in advancing our knowledge of the botanical world.
content.source_2:
**Porto, Portugal - December 2039**

Renowned Polish Botanist Łukasz Piechnik Bids Farewell to Unidade Local de Saúde de Santo António After 11 Years of Service

In a bittersweet ceremony held at the Unidade Local de Saúde de Santo António (ULS SA) in Porto, Portugal, Dr. Łukasz Piechnik, a distinguished Polish botanist, marked the end of his 11-year tenure at the esteemed healthcare institution. Dr. Piechnik, who joined ULS SA in June 2028, has been an integral part of the hospital's botanical research department, focusing on the development of innovative, plant-based treatments for various diseases. During his time at the hospital, he has made significant contributions to the field, publishing numerous papers and collaborating with international researchers. "It's been an incredible journey," Dr. Piechnik said in an exclusive interview with our publication. "I'm grateful for the opportunity to have worked alongside such a talented team and to have had the chance to make a difference in the lives of our patients." Under Dr. Piechnik's leadership, the botanical research department at ULS SA has seen a significant increase in funding and recognition, with several breakthroughs in the development of new medicines derived from rare plant species. "Dr. Piechnik's dedication and expertise have been invaluable to our institution," said Dr. Maria Rodrigues, Director of ULS SA. "His work has not only advanced our understanding of botanical medicine but has also improved the lives of countless patients. He will be deeply missed, but we are excited to see the impact he will continue to make in the scientific community." Dr. Piechnik's departure from ULS SA marks the end of an era, but his legacy will continue to inspire future generations of researchers and healthcare professionals. As he embarks on a new chapter in his career, the scientific community eagerly awaits his next breakthrough. **Data:**

* During Dr. Piechnik's tenure, the botanical research department at ULS SA saw a 300% increase in funding. * Dr. Piechnik has published 25 papers in reputable scientific journals, with a total of 1,200 citations.
